meanings.definition: To restore color to (something) by repigmenting.
meanings.sent1: She repigmented the faded wall with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The artist repigmented the dull canvas with vibrant hues.
meanings.sent3: The room looked so sad, she decided to repigment it with cheerful colors.
meanings.sent4: Her smile repigmented the gloomy atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The garden bloomed after she repigmented it with colorful flowers.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the old photograph repigmented, revealing its original colors.
meanings.sent2: The leaves repigmented as the tree absorbed more sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon seemed to repigment its skin to match the pattern of the wallpaper.
meanings.sent4: His face repigmented with embarrassment when he realized his mistake.
meanings.sent5: The sky repigmented with shades of pink as the sun set.
